page.title: 04PARSONAGE FARM,ELMSTEAD
page.content: It is thought that on the site of {Parsonage Farm}there used to be a Saxon settlement.Parsonage Farm itself was built by{Jesus College}in about 1540.A{Parson}lived in the farmhouse in the sixteenth century,which is how it got its name,he also farmed the sixty acres which belonged to it.Later it was changed into three cottages, then two and now it is one cottage again.It was bought and{renovated}by the present owners in 1981, they are only the second people to have owned it. There used to be a{moat}around the farmhouse which they think had a {drawbridge. Little is known about the history of the farmhouse because the deeds are written in Medieval Latin and it has not been translated as yet.{
